Sunday, November 17, 2013 (4:30 PM - 6:30 PM)
Location: Upper Sproul

ASUC SUPERB is excited to bring Born Ruffians to the UC Berkeley campus for FREE on Sunday November 17 on Upper Sproul.

Toronto's Born Ruffians feature Luke LaLonde (vocals/guitar), Mitch DeRosier (bass/vocals), and Steve Hamelin (drums). Formed in 2002, the indie rock trio creates a jaunty mix of shifty guitar riffs and hyper-chic vocals for a Pixies-esque shredded kind of sweetness. An appearance at the annual Pop Montreal festival and U.S. tour dates with Hot Chip and Shy Child coincided with the release of Born Ruffians' self-titled debut EP for Warp Records in October 2006. The band's first full-length, Red Yellow & Blue, arrived in spring 2008. They returned with 2010's Say It, which the band recorded in two weeks with producer Rusty Santos. In 2013, Born Ruffians delivered their third studio album, Birthmarks, featuring the single "Needle."
